name: THEA 126
title: Acting Studio III
description: Individual work on acting skills and problems, with emphasis on individual interpretation and scene work with other students. THEA 21 and THEA 124 are recommended as preparation. Admission is by audition at the first class meeting (see the department office or theater.ucsc.edu for more information). May be repeated for credit.
class_notes: ENROLLMENT - two options: 1) Students who have passed THEA 20 or THEA 21 will not be required to audition. 2) Admission-by-audition on the first day of class. Please prepare one 45 - 90 second monologue or movement piece of your choice. All students admitted to the class will be given an enrollment permission number by the instructor during the first week of the class. Questions can be addressed to the instructor:nluce@ucsc.edu. CLASS TOPIC for Fall 2023: "Foundations in Intimacy" - Intimacy Choreography. This class will focus on how we create consent-based and trauma-informed practice in rehearsal spaces and thoughtfully construct intimacy in performance. The class will examine the power of boundary practice, choreographic language, and how we can serve the most vulnerable person in the room through our artistry. Artists of all disciplines are welcome to partake in this course. Each student will have the opportunity to perform, choreograph, and direct in this class.
